body: @Cnly are you going to have a go at fixing this?

@ncw I haven't looked into it yet because I've been pretty busy... :( But I expect to have time for this in two or three days. Of course if you (or anybody else) have a fix already or have a plan to fix it, I'd really appreciate it!

I'm able to reproduce this with the latest master version and OneDrive Personal, and thanks so much to @B4dM4n for digging into the problem. I think your analysis is correct that `readMetaDataForPath` shouldn't assume `dc.findRoot == true` even if `dc.Get("")` returns an ID. But I think instead of calling `dc.FindRoot(false)` in `readMetaDataForPath`, it may be better to call `dc.RootParentID()` and see if it returns an error. That way we don't need to have network traffic.

`dc.RootParentID()` returns an error immediately if any of the following is true:
- `!dc.findRoot`
- `dc.rootParentID == ""` (which is impossible because the code after [onedrive.go#379](https://github.com/ncw/rclone/blob/b9e16b36e5208dc7460af59d9e75dc8234caca27/backend/onedrive/onedrive.go#L379) only runs if root is inside a folder so it must have a parent)
- `dc.rootID == dc.trueRootID` (which is also impossible because root is inside a folder)

And if `dc.RootParentID()` returns an error, we know `dc.findRoot == false` and will proceed with the "query manually" branch.

Finally, there should also be a unit test for this.

@ncw @B4dM4n Would like to hear your comments.

The different betwen calling `dc.RootParentID()` and `dc.FindRoot(false)` is that the latter will actually find the root if needed.  The old code `dc.Get("")` didn't find the root so I think `dc.RootParentID()` is probably the better choice here.

I've pushed a fix [here](https://github.com/ncw/rclone/commit/6e005b025a0fdcf7823ea0d4eb6a5c8cb585d4e9), but I'm unsure how to add the tests because it seems we need to access/modify contents under the absolute root of a backend.

> I've pushed a fix [here](https://github.com/ncw/rclone/commit/6e005b025a0fdcf7823ea0d4eb6a5c8cb585d4e9), but I'm unsure how to add the tests because it seems we need to access/modify contents under the absolute root of a backend.

Hmm, I try to keep the tests contained within a directory so you can use them on repositories with data you care about in.  Can we do a test without writing to the root?  If not then I think we'll have to skip it.

I agree with you that we should not touch things outside the specified directory, and now I came up with a way to do the test.

Say we're testing using a remote whose and `remote.Root() == "user/given/path/rclone-test-1234567890"`. Then before the `FsMkdir` test finishes, we do

```go
deepRemote, err := fs.NewFs(remote.Name() + ":" + remote.Root() + "/deeper/nonexisting/directory")
require.NoError(t, err)

firstSlashIndex := strings.IndexRune(deepRemote.Root(), '/')
firstDir := deepRemote.Root()[:firstSlashIndex]
_, err = deepRemote.NewObject(firstDir)
require.Equal(t, fs.ErrorObjectNotFound, err)
```

The first two lines create a remote whose `dirCache.foundRoot == false`. The last four lines try getting the object at the absolute path `user/given/path/rclone-test-1234567890/deeper/nonexisting/directory/user`, which doesn't exist. And if the backend code is assuming `dirCache.Get("")` to be the ID of `user/given/path/rclone-test-1234567890/deeper/nonexisting/directory` (while it's actually the ID of the absolute root), `deepRemote.NewObject` will not return `fs.ErrorObjectNotFound` and the test will fail.

I tested with OneDrive before and after the fix and it worked. Now one thing I'm concerned about is whether there is any backend that returns `fs.ErrorObjectNotFound` in `NewObject` because it thinks "there _is_ a directory, not an object, so the _object_ is not found".
@ncw Can we run this new test against all backends and see if it breaks things?

issue.title: Fix #3164 Onedrive skips files; add FsRootCollapse test

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
#### What is the purpose of this change?

This PR fixes #3164, and also adds a unit test to prevent similar failures in the future.

#### Was the change discussed in an issue or in the forum before?

The changes have been discussed and explained in https://github.com/ncw/rclone/issues/3164.

#### Checklist

- [x] I have read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/ncw/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#submitting-a-pull-request).
- [x] I have added tests for all changes in this PR if appropriate.
- [x] I have added documentation for the changes if appropriate.
- [x] All commit messages are in [house style](https://github.com/ncw/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit-messages).
- [x] I'm done, this Pull Request is ready for review :-)
